info.name: Primalbound
info.author: William Burruss
info.description: Martial shapeshifter class inspired by weregorillas. No spellcasting. Gains strength, defenses, and breath weapon while transformed.

element.name: Primalbound
element.description: Primalbound are fierce warriors who channel a bestial spirit, unleashing tremendous power and resilience in their transformed state. They specialize in devastating melee attacks, mighty leaps, and unparalleled fortitude.

setters.set: Feral warriors who transform into powerful beasts of rage and resilience.

element.name: Burst of Brawn
element.description: You gain advantage on Strength checks and saving throws while not wearing heavy armor.

element.name: Primal Transformation
element.description: As a bonus action, you may transform into a primal beast for 1 minute. While transformed: - Gain +2 to melee damage rolls - Gain +1 AC - Gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage - Once per transformation, you may use a 15-ft cone breath weapon (Dex save DC = 8 + proficiency + Strength) for 2d6 damage (half on save) You can transform a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

element.name: Bestial Resilience
element.description: While transformed, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

element.name: Mighty Leap
element.description: You can jump three times your normal distance, and take no fall damage from heights less than 40 feet if you land on your feet.

element.name: Extra Attack
element.description: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

element.name: Advanced Transformation
element.description: At 11th level, while transformed, you regain 5 HP at the start of each of your turns and your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19–20.

element.name: Primal Dominance
element.description: At 18th level, your transformation now lasts for 10 minutes. While transformed, you are immune to the frightened and charmed conditions.

element.name: Ability Score Improvement
element.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
